list_definition.definition: (opposite unhygienic) free from germs or dirt

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Hygienic conditions are essential in a hospital.

list_ex_of_english: Maternalist objectives led to the creation of charitable, educational, and hygienic institutions that improved the general welfare of the citizen.
Only to perceive and never to exude odors may not be, after all, as hygienic as one might have thought.
This project to ' control water ' always involved a parallel campaign of citizen improvement, that is, to create a ' hygienic instinct ' among the lower classes.
The association of ascariasis with several risk factors, such as socio-economic level, hygienic habits and housing factors, is also discussed.
Hygienic conditions are one factor affecting the risk.
On the surface, colonial hygienic drives seemed to differ little from metropolitan ones.
Before the outbreak of war, serum hosts were kept under excellent hygienic conditions.
Calculation of an equitability index revealed that the specific richness was less equitable once socioeconomic conditions and hygienic practices were improved.
